intro: Pennellia microsperma, commonly known as the small-seeded pennellia, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Apiaceae. It is characterized by its slender, hairy stems and small, clustered leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that are typically arranged in umbels, a common feature in the carrot family. Pennellia microsperma is native to certain regions of North America and thrives in moist, sandy soils. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and horticultural studies.
